verses.text: We come together chiefly to bring out the holy truth regarding God; and we have separated them, because they do not agree with the Church in theology, nor with us the sons of the Scriptures.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:12
verses.text: On this account we have sundered them from the Church, and have left what concerns them to God, who will judge His creatures with justice.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:13
verses.text: To those, moreover, who are not cognisant of them, we make this known without ill-will, in order that they may not rush into an evil death, like heretics, but may gain eternal life, and teach their sons and their posterity this one true faith.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:14
verses.text: Canon Second.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:15
verses.text: Of bishops.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:16
verses.text: A bishop should be elected by all the people, and he should be unimpeachable, as it is written of him in the apostle; in the week in which he is ordained, the whole people should also say, We desire him; and there should be silence in the whole hall, and they should all pray in his behalf, and say, O God, stablish him whom Thou hast prepared for us, etc.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:17
verses.text: Canon Third.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:18
verses.text: Prayer in behalf of him who is made bishop, and the ordinance of the Missa.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:19
verses.text: O God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all consolation, etc.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:20
verses.text: Canon Fourth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:21
verses.text: Of the ordination of a presbyter.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:22
verses.text: Canon Fifth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:23
verses.text: Of the constituting a deacon.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:24
verses.text: Canon Sixth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:25
verses.text: Of those who have suffered for the faith.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:26
verses.text: Canon Seventh.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:27
verses.text: Of him who is elected reader and sub-deacon.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:28
verses.text: Canon Eighth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:29
verses.text: Of the gift of healings.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:30
verses.text: Canon Ninth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:31
verses.text: That a presbyter should not dwell in unbefitting places; and of the honour of widows.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:32
verses.text: Canon Tenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:33
verses.text: Of those who wish to become Nazarenes (Christians).

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:34
verses.text: Canon Eleventh.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:35
verses.text: Of him who makes idols and images, or the artificer.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:36
verses.text: Canon Twelfth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:37
verses.text: Of the prohibition of those works, the authors of which are not to be received but on the exhibition of repentance.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:38
verses.text: Canon Thirteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:39
verses.text: Of a prince or a soldier, that they be not received indiscriminately.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:40
verses.text: Canon Fourteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:41
verses.text: That a Nazarene may not become a soldier unless by order.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:42
verses.text: Canon Fifteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:43
verses.text: Enumeration of works which are unlawful.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:44
verses.text: Canon Sixteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:45
verses.text: Of him who has a lawful wife, and takes another beside her.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:46
verses.text: Canon Seventeenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:47
verses.text: Of a free-born woman, and her duties.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:48
verses.text: Of midwives, and of the separation of men from women.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:49
verses.text: Of virgins, that they should cover their faces and their heads.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:50
verses.text: Canon Eighteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:51
verses.text: Of women in childbed, and of midwives again.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:52
verses.text: Canon Nineteenth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:53
verses.text: Of catechumens, and the ordinance of Baptism and the Missa.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:54
verses.text: Canon Twentieth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:55
verses.text: Of the fast the six days, and of that of Lent.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:56
verses.text: Canon Twenty-first.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:57
verses.text: Of the daily assembling of priests and people in the church.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:58
verses.text: Canon Twenty-second.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:59
verses.text: Of the week of the Jews' passover, wherein joy shall be put away, and of what is eaten therein; and of him who, being brought up abroad, is ignorant of the Calendar.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:60
verses.text: Canon Twenty-third.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:61
verses.text: Of doctrine, that it should be continuous, greater than the sea, and that its words ought to be fulfilled by deeds.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:62
verses.text: Canon Twenty-fourth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:63
verses.text: Of the bishop's visitation of the sick; and that if an infirm man has prayed in the church, and has a house, he should go to him.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:64
verses.text: Canon Twenty-fifth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:65
verses.text: Of the procurator appointed for the sick, and of the bishop, and the times of prayer.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:66
verses.text: Canon Twenty-sixth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:67
verses.text: Of the hearing of the word in church, and of praying in it.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:68
verses.text: Canon Twenty-seventh.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:69
verses.text: Of him who does not come to church daily,—let him read books; and of prayer at midnight and cock-crowing, and of the washing of hands at the time of any prayer.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:70
verses.text: Canon Twenty-eighth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:71
verses.text: That none of the believers should taste anything, but after he has taken the sacred mysteries, especially in the days of fasting.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:72
verses.text: Canon Twenty-ninth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:73
verses.text: Of the keeping of oblations which are laid upon the altar,—that nothing fall into the sacred chalice, and that nothing fall from the priests, nor from the boys when they take communion; that an evil spirit rule them not, and that no one speak in the protection, except in prayer; and when the oblations of the people cease, let psalms be read with all attention, even to the signal of the bell; and of the sign of the cross, and the casting of the dust of the altar into the pool.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:74
verses.text: Canon Thirtieth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:75
verses.text: Of catechumens and the like.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:76
verses.text: Canon Thirty-first.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:77
verses.text: Of the bishop and presbyter bidding the deacons present the communion.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:78
verses.text: Canon Thirty-second.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:79
verses.text: Of virgins and widows, that they should pray and fast in the church.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:80
verses.text: Let those who are given to the clerical order pray according to their judgment.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:81
verses.text: Let not a bishop be bound to fasting but with the clergy.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:82
verses.text: And on account of a feast or supper, let him prepare for the poor.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:83
verses.text: Canon Thirty-third.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:84
verses.text: Of the Atalmsas (the oblation), which they shall present for those who are dead, that it be not done on the Lord's day.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:85
verses.text: Canon Thirty-fourth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:86
verses.text: That no one speak much, nor make a clamour; and of the entrance of the saints into the mansions of the faithful.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:87
verses.text: Canon Thirty-fifth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:88
verses.text: Of a deacon present at a feast at which there is a presbyter present,—let him do his part in prayer and the breaking of bread for a blessing, and not for the body; and of the discharge of widows.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:89
verses.text: Canon Thirty-sixth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:90
verses.text: Of the first-fruits of the earth, and the first dedication of them; and of presses, oil, honey, milk, wool, and the like, which may be offered to the bishop for his blessing.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:91
verses.text: Canon Thirty-seventh.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:92
verses.text: As often as a bishop takes of the sacred mysteries, let the deacons and presbyters be gathered together, clothed in white robes, brilliant in the view of all the people; and in like manner with a reader.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:93
verses.text: Canon Thirty-eighth.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:94
verses.text: Of the night on which our Lord Jesus Christ rose.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:95
verses.text: That no one shall sleep on that night, and wash himself with water; and a declaration concerning such a one; and a declaration concerning him who sins after baptism, and of things lawful and unlawful.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:96
verses.text: The sacred canons of the holy patriarch Hippolytus, the first patriarch of the great city of Rome, which he composed, are ended; and the number of them is thirty-eight canons.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:97
verses.text: May the Lord help us to keep them.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:98
verses.text: And to God be glory for ever, and on us be His mercy for ever.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 51:99
verses.text: Amen.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:4
verses.text: )  "This name" (θεοτόκος), says Pearson, "was first in use in the Greek Church, which, delighting in the happy compositions of that language, so called the Blessed Virgin; from which the Latins, in imitation, styled her Virginem Deiparam," etc.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:5
verses.text: …Yet those ancient Greeks which call the Virgin θεοτόκος, did not call her μητέρα τοῦ Θεοῦ, "Mother of God".

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:6
verses.text: This was very different to a pious ear, and rests on no synodical authority.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:11
verses.text: This term has been sadly abused for Mariolatry.

verses.text: (Synaxis, p.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:14
verses.text: )  It seems to me worth while to quote a few words from the new and critical edition of Leighton's Works, which should be consulted for fuller information.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:15
verses.text: The editor says:  "Leighton uses a word for the Holy Communion which is worth noting, because it is rarely used by Western theologians".

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:16
verses.text: The word Synaxis is but a Christianized form of the word Synagogue; but, like the word κοινωνία, it points to Christ's mystical body,—"gathering together in one the children of God".

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:17
verses.text: Synaxis = συνάγει εἰς ἕν.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:18
verses.text: It sums up the idea, "We, being many, are one Bread and one Body, for we are all partakers of that one Bread".

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:19
verses.text: Compare John xi.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:20
verses.text: and  Cor.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:21
verses.text: x.

verses.text: St.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:23
verses.text: Chrysostom calls the Synaxis φρικωδεστάτη, which is a very different thing from maxime tremenda, as applied to the modern "Mass," in behalf of which it is quoted.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:24
verses.text: For Chrysostom applies it to the participation of the "Synaxis," and not to the "oblation," much less to the "Host" as an object of adoration, of which he never heard or dreamed.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:25
verses.text: He calls "the Synaxis" Shudderful (to borrow a word from the Germans), because the unworthy recipient, in the Synaxis, eats and drinks his own condemnation.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:26
verses.text: One must ever be on his guard against the subtlety which reads into the Fathers modern ideas under ancient phrases.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:27
verses.text: Precisely so Holy Scripture itself is paraphrased into Trent doctrine, as in Acts xiii.

verses.name: Hippolytus: Appendix 52:28
verses.text: the Louvain versionists rendered the text, "And while they offered the sacrifice of the Mass and fasted".
